title: Is it proper to double-space dialogue line breaks? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unfortunately, there is no standard for line spacing for manuscripts. There is only what is common. Most dialogues do receive far greater line spacing than a traditional business document, but this does not directly mean double-spacing. This line spacing typically ranges from 1.5 to 2, while business documents are typically only 1.15 for line spacing. It’s a good idea to check out your clients and competitors in your specific industry to find the norm. Then setup a good template for yourself in Microsoft Word and you’ll never have to worry about spacing again.
Yes. Editors read thousands of manuscripts—you want to make everything as easy as possible on them. When your eyes are tired, single spacing turns the page into a grey blob.
